[[Image:WorldsofFrankHerbert.jpg|thumb|right|160px|''[[The Worlds of Frank Herbert]]'']]
 
'''"Committee of the Whole"''' is a [[short story]] by [[science fiction]] author [[Frank Herbert]] which first appeared in [[Galaxy Science Fiction | Galaxy]] magazine in 1965 and later in Herbert's 1985 short story collection ''[[The Worlds of Frank Herbert]]''. It deals with the concept of [[Self control| restraint]] as a paramount virtue necessary for survival of a human race in times when both information and the means for production of [[Weapon of mass destruction | weapons of mass destruction]] are available to every individual.
'''"Committee of the Whole"''' is a [[short story]] by [[science fiction]] author [[Frank Herbert]] which first appeared in [[Galaxy Science Fiction | Galaxy]] magazine in 1965 and later in Herbert's 1985 short story collection ''[[The Worlds of Frank Herbert]]''. It deals with the concept of [[Self control| restraint]] as a paramount virtue necessary for survival of a human race in times when both information and the means for production of [[Weapon of mass destruction | weapons of mass destruction]] are available to every individual.
